text: "Can't Go for That" is a song by Canadian recording artist Tamia. It was written by Missy Elliott, Brycyn Evans and Roosevelt "Bink" Harrell for her second studio album A Nu Day (2000), featuring main production from the latter with Elliottt and Evans serving as co-producers. Musically, the song includes an interpolation of "I Can't Go For That (No Can Do)" as performed by Hall & Oates. "Can't Go for That" was released as the album's lead single in 2000 and peaked at number 84 on the US Billboard Hot 100 and 23 on Billboards Hot R&B;/Hip-Hop Singles & Tracks chart. The single was remixed by Jonathan Peters. There is another remix version as the album bonus track which features 213 members Nate Dogg, Snoop Dogg and Warren G. ==Music video== A music video for "Can't Go for That" was directed by Chris Hafner in the week of July 1, 2000. It was filmed in Los Angeles. ==Track listings== == Credits and personnel == Credits adapted from the liner notes of A Nu Day. *Co-producer – Brycyn Evans, Missy Elliott *Assistant engineer – Edith Luis *Mixing, recording – Bill Importico *Producer – Bink! ==Charts== ===Weekly charts=== {| class="wikitable sortable plainrowheaders" |- ! Chart (2000) !
